note.p: Birth: Deptford, Kent, England, Europe (13 March 1622)
Death: Gresham College, London, England, Europe (27 June 1662)
Burial: St Martin's Outwich, Threadneedle Street, London, England, Europe
Education: Eton College; King's College, Cambridge (admitted 19 June 1639; BA (1643); MA (1647)); Wadham College, Oxford (admitted 1650)

Career: Fellow of King's College (1643); Retired to his estate in Kent (1647); Fellow-Commoner at Wadham College, Oxford (1650); Assisted Robert Boyle (FRS 1660) with his chemical experiments; Professor of Astronomy, Gresham College (1652-1657); Featured in Seth Ward's 'De cometis' (1654); Professor of Geometry (1657-1662); Intended to complete observations on Jupiter before his death
First official meeting of the Royal Society held in his quarters at Gresham College on 28 November 1660.
Sources: DNB; DSB; Venn; Foster; Ward; Hunter
References: Colin A Ronan 'Laurence Rooke (1622-1662)' NR' vol 15 (1960) p. 113-118
N J W Thrower, 'Samuel Pepys FRS (1633-1733) and The Royal Society' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 3-13
